result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan J Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.
Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge.
  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must be in school or employed full time.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
The no contact provisiion is lifted-defendant may have contact with his friends.
No alcohol or controlled substances.  Defendant must participate in and complete any assessments deemed appropriate by the agent.  
Defendant to engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
If defendant completes probation and has no new charges, this case can be expunged.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). No contact w/1709 Franklin Street.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. ******AMENDED 7/10/14: SCRAM CONDITION IS REMOVED FROM BOND******
Motion hearing on August 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Evan J Martinez in court with attorney David Saldana.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Defense will file a Motion challenging the complaint. Defense requests bond modification. State has no objection. BTC: SCRAM unit is removed from bond.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
